lines.text: I = moment of inertia, m = mass, r = distance of particle from axis

secText: The moment of inertia of any object can be computed with the equation in this section.

The moment of inertia of a single particle is its mass times the square of its distance from the axis of rotation. For a rigid system of particles rotating about an axis, the moment of inertia is the sum of the moments of inertia of all the particles in the system.
The unit used to measure moment of inertia is the product of the unit of mass and the square of the unit of distance.
